value.title: Incremental refresh for free in Power BI
value.excerpt: As you probably are aware, incremental refresh is a premium feature only, but with some DAX magic, you can get incremental refresh for free on Desktop and service!! value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw

value.title: Link Power BI to an Excel file in SharePoint Online
value.excerpt: In this vlog, we will learn how we can consume data from the Excel Online to Power BI. Our Excel file has been stored in the SharePoint Document Library.   We need to fetch the data from SharePoint Document Library’s Excel file to Power BI Desktop. In this video, we will learn step by step procedure

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
